main event: A bright light flashed across the horizon, possibly a meteor, in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania on February 7, 1955.
interesting points: The sighting was a momentary observation of a single object.
The object was observed from the ground and was tracked on radar.
The object was reported to have flashed across the horizon, which is consistent with a meteor.
The report includes a brief summary of the sighting and the conclusion that there was insufficient data to make a definitive evaluation.
The report was filed as part of Project Blue Book, the U.S. Air Force's investigation of UFO sightings during the 1950s.
